name: Firefly Online Cortex
description: The Cortex is your ultimate destination for Firefly Online news and information. This companion app is a great way to stay current with the game’s progress, take advantage of special offers and gain access to exclusive content!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or greater Processor: 1.5Ghz or greater Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: DX9 (shader model 2.0) capabilitie DirectX: Version 9.0b Storage: 250 MB available space

reviews.review_text: The Firefly Online Cortex was a nice distraction, for a time.  Intended as a companion app for the forthcoming release of Firefly Online. There are some nice banjo tunes, reminiscient of the Firefly series. You're given the opportunity to spent some money, in support of the team, developing Firefly Online. For 5$ you'll get to be a   'Big Damn Hero'.  Sounds shiny. For your money, you'll be able the access a devblog, which has rather been neglected, if not desserted. When there is a post, its saddly more fluff, than any real information.   Also you'll get access to a map of 'The Verse', where you are able to do Trade Runs. Meaning clicking on three planets on the map, to get a loot box. In this box are cards, with pictures from the series. Collecting these cards rewards you some in-game fluff for the game.  One run gets you 50 Brownie Points, the in-app currency. The random generator hates everyone the same, as the devs pointed out. So you can get as high as 500.000 Brownie Points, or higher, and still be  left wanting for some cards, to finish your set.   But you'll also presented with the oppurtunity to buy card packs, in different price categories. If you're easy to be enraged, you  should be careful, as these packs also can tend to give you duplicates of cards you'll already have.   Update:  The Big Damn Hero Package is, as of now, not more available.

The very first game I made an in-game purchase, ever. By sheer, unbelievable coincidence, I finished rewatching the whole series on Hulu two days ago. And right after that I learned about FFO — what a pleasant surprise! My favorite genre, single player RPG, in my favorite setting, space western. This companion app is a welcome distraction for all the fans who have been waiting for the game for over a year now. The app is not much yet, but neat and simple. The purchases are really more like crowdfunding contributions towards the big game — and it feels nice to participate.

This is a damn shiny app! It's more of a news/info/map of the Verse app than a game, BUT there's multiple ways to earn BPs (Brownie Points - cute huh?), which, simply put, will turn into currency in-game once FFO is out! Plenty of 'making of' video clips while they make it too! (And just a taste of Nathan as Mal in the Trade Route mini-game!) This companion app has more effort put into it than MOST MOBILE GAMES.  And before I'm flamed, YES, this is kind of freemium, BUT you have the power to buy or not, and it's balanced enough that you can keep going *without* purchases. Those just speed things up. And the cash that goes in seems to be going to the development of FFO, so who knows? Might be buying them time and resources the company running FFO isn't giving them! (Not sure if this is accurate though. But hell, in game they offer links to ALL their social media. Ask them where the cash goes. As far as I know, the above is true. Even selling the show digitally/on disc to raise funds via Amazon. Amazon gets a percentage, as does the dev team.)  TL;DR: (AKA In short), It's free, interesting, and if you dislike it, easy to uninstall! (And if you're lost, start with the TV show, then the one movie. ;) )

A quick yet entertaining diversion, a few minutes of fun for interesting rewards, and hopefully some beneficial rewards in the game to come. Cons- - Repetative with little variety. - No leaderboard.   Whilst a leaderboard wouldn't show much but how much griding some people have done it would be curious to know. Worth a look and a quick browse, shows some early promise if such a simple app can be made this entertaining.

What this is, isn't much. It's not meant to be. It's just a companion app to the upcoming Firefly MMO, which let you reserve an account and check news on the game. Don't expect more than that.  Using this app gives you brownie points, which will be used in the game when it launches.  If you are willing to dish out $5 to support development, you can get the Big Damn Heroes package, which unlocks a minigame and additional features. I do not have this package to say what it does, but I am curious.   As far as the unpaid version, this is not a game. It's just a place for info on a game in development.

This is a decent little app.   The voicework is good, the cards are fun to collect, purchase is not required.  The best part is getting familiar with the planets in the 'verse and where they are located. That ought to help when the full game is released (this summer IIRC).
It's a game where you have to pay to play.
The map is great. The info is great. The card collecting is fun in and of itself.  It's pretty, it runs well, but it can get a little repetitive at times.

I have played on the Cortex on my PC and Android. PC play allows me to better appreciate the work that went into the Cortex especially 'The Map of the Verse'. As a longtime Browncoat, participated in the Serenity Movie push, the Cortex is quite enjoyable. I now have a resource to explore the verse while working on my captain's backstory or captains backstories since I have two accounts. The collections of Badges and Special Items has been fun while challenging also. Have great hopes for the future and frequent trips to Wu's in mind for both accounts.  Now to address some of the problems encountered. I do this mainly because I caused some of them. The devs never expected BP millionaires. It only took a month for several of us to notch that mark. With it came some problems.  The '1969' error came from switching devices without logging out properly. To be honest I do not recall if my Android had the option originally. I only played with my Android a few times because for me a little screen does not give the 'verse the depth I desire. As for why it affected my PC I put that down to hard drive failure. In 20/20 hind sight some of the older devices should have been left out. This problem has been addressed. BP counter lag. Purely a multi-millionaire problem but it has also been addressed.  As stated many times the Cortex was to also serve as a test bed Firefly Online. In my opinion it has fufilled that purpose.   The delay in releasing Firefly Online while disappointing is understandable. The devs want to ensure that they release a quality product. It is how I would handle it if I were in charge of the release.

The Card collecting is a nice bonus too, also to unlock stuff... though I feel weird saying that >_>  Only wish more systems had detailed info, as I like those and one can already fantasize about stuff regarding the future characters. Though it might feel a bit weird to start with a small fleet ^_^' (Okay you can only pilot one at a time but still, ofc it would be hilarious if each ship had some negative effect too like a debt or maybe it was really cheap as it was 'found' somewhere, or it crated a rival..etc etc. <_<)  Overall I'm really excited about this and the future game.
